title: How bedrest and cycling in artificial gravity is being tested to aid human spaceflight
summary: For two months, 12 people from France will be put into a “compulsory reclined lifestyle” to study the impacts that microgravity has on astronauts and whether cycling in artificial gravity could combat the negative effects human spaceflight has on the body. The Bedrest with Artificial Gravity and Cycling Exercise (BRACE) is led by the European Space Agency (ESA) and the French Space Agency (CNES) and will mark the first bedrest study involving cycling in Europe.

title: ULA To Conduct Vulcan Flight Readiness Firing Today
summary: ULA announced this afternoon that they are planning to conduct another attempt at the Flight Readiness Firing of the twin BE-4 engines of their next generation Vulcan-Centaur launch vehicle today.

title: Chinese commercial rocket firm launches 26 satellites, sets national record
summary: A Chinese commercial launch firm conducted its second orbital mission Wednesday, sending a reported record 26 satellites into orbit.

title: Wildfire smoke and haze in the Eastern United States should peak this week
summary: New York City had the worst air quality in the world on Tuesday.

title: RFA ONE Creeps Ever Closer to the Launchpad
summary: Last week, Rocket Factory Augsburg (RFA) announced that it had successfully completed the Integrated System Test (IST) campaign for the RFA ONE second stage. The IST campaign included several hot fire tests and culminated in a full-duration 280-second test of the first RFA ONE second stage.

title: York Space Systems acquires Emergent Space Technologies
summary: Satellite manufacturer York Space Systems announced June 7 it has acquired Emergent Space Technologies, a small business that develops flight software and engineering tools for space missions.

title: Space investment rebounding, but more selectively
summary: After a recent downturn, there are signs of a rebound in space investment, but analysts and investors see a new focus on smaller, more selective rounds.

title: Apogeo Space orders second space tug for connectivity constellation
summary: Apogeo Space, an Italian venture with plans for nearly 100 tiny satellites for connecting remote monitoring devices, said June 5 it had signed a deal to deploy nine picosatellites next year with an orbital transfer vehicle from Momentus.

title: Space Force opens new office to foster ties with private sector
summary: The Space Systems Command on June 6 opened a new office and conference center dedicated for doing business with the commercial space industry.

title: NASA Names Winners of 2023 Student Rocket Launch Competition
summary: NASA announced Tuesday the University of Alabama in Huntsville is the overall winner of the agency’s 2023 Student Launch challenge.
